4228476989,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-causal-inference-new-product-development-at-lyft-4228476989?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=1syeJH9VB44tXsK%2FMi1Alw%3D%3D&trackingId=h947U4SmiHpBxkFPS5fnNg%3D%3D,"Data Scientist, Causal Inference - New Product Development",Lyft,"Toronto, Ontario, Canada","At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.

Data Science is at the heart of Lyft’s products and decision-making. As a member of the Rider Science team, you will work in a dynamic environment, where we embrace moving quickly to build the world’s best transportation. Data Scientists take on a variety of problems, ranging from shaping critical business decisions to building algorithms that power our internal and external products. We’re looking for passionate, driven Data Scientists to take on some of the most interesting and impactful problems in ridesharing.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with chops in Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields to join the Rider Segments team. In it, you will leverage data, analytical thinking, and rigorous machine learning and causal modeling to bring to life zero-to-one products tailored to our most impactful and strategic rider segments and their use cases. We're looking for execution-oriented scientists who are passionate about solving challenging problems with data and mathematical models, and are excited about working in a fast-paced, innovative environment. You will bring a quantitative mindset to decision-making in partnership with engineers, product, business, and marketing stakeholders across organizations and drive roadmaps to create products solving the needs of millions of riders.
You will report to a Data Science Manager in the Rider team.
Responsibilities:

Partner with other scientists and colleagues in the rider segments team, and with external teams across driver, marketplace and business to frame problems mathematically and within the business context
Perform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of problems
Develop and fit statistical, causal and machine learning models
Design, implement and analyze experiments or leverage other quasi-experimental observational methodologies to measure performance
Communicate findings and facilitate launch decisions
Develop causal measurement methodologies to monitor the health of our products, as well as the impacts on user outcomes and marketplace outcomes
Experience:
M.S. or Ph.D. in Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields
1-2+ years of professional experience for PhDs or 2-4+ years for Master’s in a data scientist role
Passion for solving unstructured and non-standard mathematical problems
End-to-end experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualization
Proficiency with Python, or another interpreted programming language like R or Matlab
Familiar with SQL - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets
Ability to collaborate and communicate with others to solve a problem
Strong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners
Benefits:
Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefits
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Child care and pet benefits
Access to a Lyft funded Health Care Savings Account
RRSP plan to help save for your future

In addition to provincial observed holidays, salaried team members are covered under Lyft's flexible paid time off policy. The policy allows team members to take off as much time as they need (with manager approval). Hourly team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service
Lyft is proud to support new parents with 18 weeks of paid time off, designed as a top-up plan to complement provincial programs. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible.
Subsidized commuter benefits

Lyft is committed to creating an inclusive workforce that fosters belonging. Lyft believes that every person has a right to equal employment opportunities without discrimination because of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, pardoned record of offences, or any other basis protected by applicable law or by Company policy. Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Accommodation for persons with disabilities will be provided upon request in accordance with applicable law during the application and hiring process. Please contact your recruiter if you wish to make such a request.

Lyft highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office at least 3 days per week, including on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Lyft considers working in the office at least 3 days per week to be an essential function of this hybrid role. Your recruiter can share more information about the various in-office perks Lyft offers. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year. #Hybrid

The expected base pay range for this position in the Toronto area is CAD $108,000 - $135,000. Salary ranges are dependent on a variety of factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location. Range is not inclusive of potential equity offering, bonus or benefits. Your recruiter can share more information about the salary range specific to your working location and other factors during the hiring process.

4258069884,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-pythian-4258069884?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=1syeJH9VB44tXsK%2FMi1Alw%3D%3D&trackingId=PhWyd%2BTn8CG0KVplQVMb%2BA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Pythian,"Toronto, Ontario, Canada","Canada | Remote | Work from home
Why Pythian

At Pythian, we are experts in strategic database and analytics services, driving digital transformation and operational excellence. Pythian, a multinational company, was founded in 1997 and started by ensuring the reliability and performance of mission-critical databases. We quickly earned a reputation for solving tough data challenges. We were there when the industry moved from on-premises to cloud environments, and as enterprises sought more from their data, we expanded our competencies to include advanced analytics.

Today, we empower organizations to embrace transformation and leverage advanced technologies, including AI, to stay competitive. We deliver innovative solutions that meet each client’s data goals and have built strong partnerships with Google Cloud, AWS, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, and Snowflake. The powerful combination of our extensive expertise in data and cloud and our ability to keep on top of the latest bleeding edge technologies make us the perfect partner to help mid and large-sized businesses transform to stay ahead in today’s rapidly changing digital economy.
Why you?

As a Pythian Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leveraging your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling to deliver insights and build predictive models. You will work on both internal IP development and client projects, applying a variety of techniques to solve complex business problems. Additionally, you will use and fine-tune pre-trained models, such as Large Language Models (LLMs), to accelerate development and enhance model performance.
What will you be doing?
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and implement machine learning models, including both supervised and unsupervised techniques.
Fine-tune and adapt pre-trained models (e.g., LLMs) for specific use cases and client projects.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to develop data-driven solutions.
Build predictive models and algorithms that address complex business challenges.
Communicate results and insights effectively to stakeholders through data visualizations and reports.
Stay current with the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and AI, with a focus on the practical application of pre-trained models and cutting-edge technologies.
Develop and maintain internal IP around advanced analytics, model development, and AI-driven tools.
What do we need from you?
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus.
3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or a related role.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R and experience with data science libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience with pre-trained models such as Large Language Models (LLMs) or other deep learning frameworks.
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization techniques.
Experience working with databases (SQL, NoSQL) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data findings into actionable business insights.
Experience with client-facing projects or in a consulting environment is a plus.
What do you get in return?
Love your career: Competitive total rewards package with an annual bonus
Love your development: Hone your skills or learn new ones with our substantial training allowance
column2: participate in professional development days, attend conferences, become certified, whatever you like!

column1: Love your work/life balance: Why commute? Work remotely from your home (forever), there’s no daily travel requirement to an office! You can be located anywhere in the US or Canada, all you need is a stable internet connection.
Love your workspace: We give you all the equipment you need to work from home including a laptop with your choice of OS, and an annual budget to personalise your work environment!
Love your community: Blog during work hours
column2: take a day off and volunteer for your favorite charity.

column1: Hiring Disclaimer
The successful applicant will need to fulfill the requirements necessary to obtain a background check.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

4262387036,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ml-engineer-speech-to-speech-%E2%80%94-subject-matter-expert-at-vosyn-4262387036?position=57&pageNum=0&refId=1syeJH9VB44tXsK%2FMi1Alw%3D%3D&trackingId=1eK74x%2BTxzbMsytGwh6HEA%3D%3D,ML Engineer (Speech-to-Speech) — Subject Matter Expert,Vosyn,"Etobicoke, Ontario, Canada","Job Title: ML Engineer (Speech-to-Speech) — Subject Matter Expert
Level: Senior SME
Department: Software Development
Status: Contract (10-15 hours/week)
Work location: Fully Remote
Compensation: Hourly ($250)

Company Overview: At Vosyn, we embrace the exciting, game-changing world of Artificial Intelligence, driving innovation and pioneering impactful projects across various industries. Our incubator, AI Venture Lab, nestled in the heart of Office146.com, is a crucible of entrepreneurial spirit, supported by intelligent processes and industry-leading best practices. We believe in fostering a culture of flexibility, continuous improvement, and solution-focused strategies. Here, every idea is welcomed, nurtured, and has the potential to scale to new heights. Currently, we're at the forefront of a significant IPO endeavor, a truly unicorn in the making. We invite you to be part of our journey and leave your imprint on the future of AI. At Vosyn, you will have the opportunity to engage with a fast-growing global organization with diversity of thought, experience, and cultures.

About the Role: We are seeking an experienced ML Engineer SME to provide strategic guidance and technical leadership on key components of our end-to-end speech-to-speech (S2S) pipeline. As a senior project advisor, you will collaborate with the VosynCore team, identifying solutions to complex challenges, particularly in text-to-speech (TTS) model development and optimization. Your expertise will be crucial in driving project progress and ensuring our S2S pipeline meets or exceeds industry standards for quality and performance.
Key Responsibilities
Provide expert-level advice and mentorship on the architecture, training, and production of text-to-speech (TTS) models
Guide the implementation of robust testing methodologies for TTS models using industry standards like MOS testing
Share expertise in distributed training, monitoring, and deployment of large-scale ML models on cloud platforms
Lead latency optimization initiatives in real-time systems for high-quality speech-to-speech conversion
Provide guidance on tuning TTS models for precise control over speech characteristics
Share in-depth knowledge of various TTS model architectures and waveform generation methods
Mentor the team on implementing advanced deep learning models for audio processing
Guide the development of transformer architectures for complex TTS model development
Required Qualifications
5+ years of proven experience in machine learning development focused on audio generation and TTS systems
Extensive expertise in audio signal processing, particularly for human voices
Deep experience with TTS models, including waveform generation and spectrogram-based methods
Proven expertise in tuning TTS models for duration control and speech characteristics
Strong proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch
Experience with advanced deep learning models like WaveNet and transformer-based architectures
Demonstrated experience in distributed training and deployment of ML models on cloud platforms
Strong understanding of evaluation metrics for TTS systems
Proven ability to provide technical leadership and actionable guidance
Excellent communication and mentoring skills
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with real-time audio processing systems
Background in speech synthesis research
Knowledge of multiple languages and accents in TTS
Experience with ML model optimization techniques
Publications or patents in related fields
Additional Perks
Be part of the invigorating journey of a pre-seed AI startup in stealth mode
Engage directly with senior management and strategic advisory board members
Gain valuable experience in the bleeding-edge AI space
Remote-first culture with flexible working arrangements

DEI and Workplace Safety: At Vosyn Inc., we are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where every employee feels valued and supported. We believe that diversity of thought, background, and experience enriches our company culture and enhances innovation. We are an equal-opportunity employer and encourage candidates from all walks of life to apply. As part of our commitment to creating a safe and healthy work environment, we prioritize workplace safety, adhering to all relevant regulations and promoting a culture of responsibility. We believe that a safe and inclusive workplace is essential for the well-being and success of our team members.
Recruitment Process
Initial Screening: Review of application and preliminary assessment
Video Interview: In-depth discussion of ML expertise and role expectations
Technical Panel Interview: Deep dive into audio processing experience and ML architecture approach
Final Selection: Assessment of overall fit and alignment
Offer and Onboarding: Equity compensation details and onboarding process.

Join a dynamic global organization that champions diversity in thought, experience, and culture. Our team is composed of top experts from around the world. We invite you to leverage your expertise, mentor future leaders, and thrive with us in this exciting journey.
Apply Now: Vosyn Careers

4268425857,https://ca.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-se-health-4268425857?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=1syeJH9VB44tXsK%2FMi1Alw%3D%3D&trackingId=YrgsAjvJQ6NvCzOHjH2vQg%3D%3D,Data Scientist,SE Health,"Markham, Ontario, Canada","Position Summary:

As part of a multi-faceted collaborative team, the Data Scientist will play a key role in the creation of a next-generation data solutions based on analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive) using statistical modeling, AI and Machine Learning. These solutions will be used by users to support strategic and/or day-to-day decisions. The incumbent will have hands-on involvement in all stages of the project lifecycle focusing on delivering data-driven operational improvements, building new data analytics capabilities and uncovering opportunities based on data insights at SE Health.

The Data Scientist works closely with stakeholders across all of SE Health as their trusted advisor in making strategic decisions to improve quality, performance, and user experience aspects of our home and community care business.
Please note: This is a hands-on role. The incumbent is expected to lead a project end-to-end: gather requirements, host workshops, gather data, develop/code, train peers, and assist with QA efforts.
Responsibilities:
Become a trusted analytics advisor
Participate in complex requirements gathering and analysis activities. Understand and document requirements, business needs, processes, and data gaps
Host workshops with technical and non-technical staff to gather requirements, share findings, and to propose ideas
Develop meaningful understanding of SE data and challenges, as well as broad challenges within home and community sector in healthcare
Ensure alignment of data solutions with SE’s strategic goals and objectives
Be the point of contact for Data Science based data solutions in SE
Create innovative data solutions
Conduct advanced, in-depth exploratory data analysis (EDA)

Why Join SE Health?
Competitive Compensation – Enjoy a Total Rewards package including salary, benefits, pension, performance incentives, on demand pay and exclusive staff perks.
Flexibility & Support – Our SE Flex program offers a unique hybrid model with work-from-home options, flexible scheduling, and a supportive culture to help you thrive.
Meaningful Impact – As a Social Enterprise, your work directly supports improving lives across Canada. Your voice matters, and innovation is encouraged.
Growth & Development – Access tuition assistance, training, and career advancement opportunities across our growing organization.
About SE Health

At SE Health, our people are everything—and our Home Office is an important part of that culture. When you choose to join SE Health, you become part of a caring, purpose-driven team that’s making a real difference across the country. Our Home Office is where innovation meets impact—supporting our direct care teams, driving strategic growth, and helping to shape the future of health care. As a member of our amazing Home Office team, you’ll collaborate with passionate colleagues, bring bold ideas to life, and contribute to meaningful work that supports thousands of care interactions each day. We believe in growing together, investing in our people, and creating an inclusive workplace where you can be yourself. Learn why you come first at SE Health.

In the interest of the health and safety of our patients/clients, employees, and greater good of public health, SE Health requires those that wish to work for this organization to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Fully vaccinated means a person has received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and it has been 14 days since the last dose.

SE Health is committed to the success of all its employees. If you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact the Talent Acquisition team at careers@sehc.com at your earliest convenience.

Position Summary:


As part of a multi-faceted collaborative team, the Data Scientist will play a key role in the creation of a next-generation data solutions based on analytics (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive) using statistical modeling, AI and Machine Learning. These solutions will be used by users to support strategic and/or day-to-day decisions. The incumbent will have hands-on involvement in all stages of the project lifecycle focusing on delivering data-driven operational improvements, building new data analytics capabilities and uncovering opportunities based on data insights at SE Health.


The Data Scientist works closely with stakeholders across all of SE Health as their trusted advisor in making strategic decisions to improve quality, performance, and user experience aspects of our home and community care business.


Please note: This is a hands-on role. The incumbent is expected to lead a project end-to-end: gather requirements, host workshops, gather data, develop/code, train peers, and assist with QA efforts.


Responsibilities:

Become a trusted analytics advisor

  • Participate in complex requirements gathering and analysis activities. Understand and document requirements, business needs, processes, and data gaps
  • Host workshops with technical and non-technical staff to gather requirements, share findings, and to propose ideas
  • Develop meaningful understanding of SE data and challenges, as well as broad challenges within home and community sector in healthcare
  • Ensure alignment of data solutions with SE’s strategic goals and objectives
  • Be the point of contact for Data Science based data solutions in SE


Create innovative data solutions

  • Conduct advanced, in-depth exploratory data analysis (EDA)
  • Communicate and refine EDA based on stakeholder input, business processes and in consideration of data quality challenges
  • Propose ML baseline models based on best practices and sound literature review
  • Develop, configure and tune Machine Learning models using Python (via Jupyter, with Pandas or other appropriate libraries as deemed appropriate)
  • Develop data models and tools to predict, categorize, quantify, and forecast key performance indicators to support strategic decision making and operational improvements (Python)
  • Build machine learning models, optimize and deploy new models into production
  • Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for data analysis, machine-learning model development, model validation and serving.
  • Perform descriptive and inferential statistical analysis in Python and/or Excel.
  • Leverage AI and Machine Learning (using Python) for data discovery, analytics, reporting and strategic business decision support
  • Maintain and expand existing Data Science/Machine Learning products and artifacts to ensure continuous growth and improvement


Propose and Adopt ML/Data Science Technology

  • Objectively evaluate different technologies: Azure ML, Databricks and in-house Python-based approach
  • Share findings of the evaluation and obtain buy-in from stakeholders
  • Find ways to streamline ML processes and its promotion to our production environments


Share insights

  • Develops and presents material to various stakeholders and levels in the organization, using excellent written and verbal communications skills, with ability to express complex concepts effectively
  • Develop informative and visually appealing analytical reports and dashboards
  • Provide meaningful interpretation of analysis and results
  • Train team members on use of vendor-created platforms, Dash, Python, and data science concepts
  • Train team members on data pipelines, feature engineering concepts and integration
  • Introduce data science capabilities, expertise, and tools to support organizational initiatives and data-driven decision making
  • Learn and leverage SE reporting / visualization tools (such as MicroStrategy, Dash) to accommodate and present work


QA

  • Support validation of existing models (QA testing against business requirements)
  • Validation/testing of developed artifacts (as well as development of user acceptance testing in collaboration with stakeholders)


Required Qualifications:

  • A master's or PhD degree in Science, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Health Information Systems, Statistics, or related discipline with a special focus on Machine Learning/AI
  • Project Leadership experience is a must – particularly in large data teams
  • Previous project or work experience utilizing AI/ML is a must
  • Must have either PhD-level project experience + 2 years of professional experience with proven track record, or alternatively at least 5 years of professional work experience in Data Science / Machine Learning
  • Expert-level Python programming
  • Moderate understanding of SQL
  • Expert-level understanding of data analytics and data science principles particularly in areas of Machine Learning
  • Solid foundations in statistics - experience with statistical data analysis
  • Proficiency in developing analytical reports and dashboards to support data-driven decision making
  • Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills
  • Self-motivated, ability to take direction, and work independently


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in healthcare is considered an asset
  • Supply chain data analysis, optimization, and forecasting
  • Familiar with data lifecycle


Why Join SE Health?

  • Competitive Compensation – Enjoy a Total Rewards package including salary, benefits, pension, performance incentives, on demand pay and exclusive staff perks.
  • Flexibility &
column2:
Support – Our SE Flex program offers a unique hybrid model with work-from-home options, flexible scheduling, and a supportive culture to help you thrive.
  • Meaningful Impact – As a Social Enterprise, your work directly supports improving lives across Canada. Your voice matters, and innovation is encouraged.
  • Growth &
column3:

At SE Health, our people are everything—and our Home Office is an important part of that culture. When you choose to join SE Health, you become part of a caring, purpose-driven team that’s making a real difference across the country. Our Home Office is where innovation meets impact—supporting our direct care teams, driving strategic growth, and helping to shape the future of health care. 4280079932,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-ii-at-jobright-ai-4280079932?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=mU4NsF5QABzGr6O0cUYpCQ%3D%3D&trackingId=slQqfEHSejkrxg8J4UY9vQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist II,Jobright.ai,San Francisco Bay Area,"Verified Job On Employer Career Site
Job Summary:

Hinge Health is a company focused on improving user outcomes in health programs through technology and data. They are seeking a Product Data Scientist to analyze and optimize post-enrollment communications, enhance user engagement, and drive adherence to treatment plans through data modeling and experimentation.
Responsibilities:
• Work with product, engineering, and care teams to optimize and personalize post-enrollment member communications, driving higher user engagement and adherence.
• Design, execute, and analyze experiments to improve user outcomes and the overall product experience.
• Develop and maintain data models to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of communication channels (email, SMS, notifications) in terms of user response, engagement, and retention.
• Set up and monitor key product metrics (e.g., user engagement, message open rates, conversion to next milestones) to assess the impact of communications on user behavior and outcomes.
• Apply machine learning and statistical models to understand and predict user behavior based on past engagement patterns, and use these insights to personalize communication strategies.
• Build and deploy anomaly detection systems to identify when communications are underperforming or when there are issues in user engagement.
• Collaborate with stakeholders across teams (Product, Marketing, Care Team) to define actionable data insights that guide the design of effective messaging strategies.
• Develop self-service tools and dashboards for stakeholders to easily access insights and track the performance of communications campaigns.
• Contribute to the creation and optimization of communication content by understanding user response trends, ensuring messages are relevant, timely, and motivating for users.
• Drive improvements in data quality, ensuring robust taxonomy and data models that support long-term communications optimization efforts.
Qualifications:
Required:
• 2+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a related role focused on product analytics and machine learning
• 2+ years of experience with Python and SQL, with the ability to transform complex data into actionable insights
• Experience with building and automating reports and dashboards for non-technical stakeholders using tools like Mode, Tableau, or similar
• Experience with productionalizing data models/ETL
Preferred:
• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Marketing, etc.)
• Experience in user engagement, communications optimization, or health tech products
• Experience working with communication platforms or marketing automation tools (e.g., Braze, Iterable, or similar)
• Familiarity with cloud-based technologies like AWS, Databricks, or Airflow
• Knowledge of healthcare or wellness industries and understanding of how digital health interventions can impact user engagement
Company:

Hinge Health is a digital clinic for joint, and muscle care, pelvic pain, bowel, and bladder control. Founded in 2015, the company is headquartered in San Francisco, California, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Public Company. Hinge Health has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

4280068540,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/chief-executive-officer-at-raw-selection-4280068540?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=mU4NsF5QABzGr6O0cUYpCQ%3D%3D&trackingId=LcbmqR5HUOEKkuxkTPjBGw%3D%3D,Chief Executive Officer,Raw Selection,United States,"THE PORTFOLIO COMPANY

This PE-backed platform delivers inspection, maintenance, and installation services across fire and life safety systems, with a primary focus on the marine sector—serving commercial vessels, private yachts, cruise lines, and military ships. With operations in Oakland, Fort Lauderdale, and Los Angeles, the business is actively transitioning from marine dominance to expanding into commercial and industrial real estate fire safety services. The company has completed three acquisitions since September 2024, with ambitions to build a national platform through both M&A and organic growth.

The platform currently generates $20M in revenue with $3.3M in YTD EBITDA and a goal to reach $5M EBITDA by year-end. The long-term vision is to scale to $15–$20M EBITDA and achieve a strategic or sponsor-backed exit.
THE PRIVATE EQUITY FIRM

The firm is a first-time fund with $100M AUM, pursuing control buyouts and aggressive buy-and-build strategies across Industrials, Business Services, and Healthcare. Their investment thesis centers on professionalizing founder-led businesses and scaling platforms through focused M&A and operational improvement. The firm is hands-on early in the hold and highly supportive in execution. They invest in people, not just assets.

Other portfolio businesses include HVAC services and fire safety platforms. The team is based in Los Angeles and is deeply involved in strategy and execution—stepping in when needed and stepping back once teams are built.
THE CULTURE

The platform is in the early stages of cultural transformation. Historically founder-led and location-centric, the business is moving from a fractured C-grade culture toward a cohesive, mission-driven environment. Pride exists at the field level, particularly in marine services, but there is a strong need for leadership to instill structure, values, and accountability.

The CEO will be instrumental in driving this cultural shift—developing leadership, building an outbound sales motion, professionalizing service delivery, and establishing core business functions such as HR and strategic operations.
VISION
What does success look like in this role?
Reach $5M EBITDA by year-end and $15–$20M within 3 years.
Execute a quarterly cadence of acquisitions with seamless integration.
Build and lead a high-performance team—VP Sales, Ops Lead, VP M&A, HR Lead.
Drive cultural transformation across three locations.
Migrate from marine-dominant to diversified fire & life safety platform.
Position the company for a strategic or sponsor-led exit.
THE ROLE
The CEO will be responsible for:
Leading all aspects of the platform—strategy, operations, financial performance, and culture.
Building and leading a team capable of scaling to $20M EBITDA.
Executing and integrating add-on acquisitions in coordination with Walk-On Capital.
Driving organic growth initiatives including outbound sales and commercial expansion.
Professionalizing all business functions: HR, service delivery, finance, and operations.
Representing the platform to the board and investors.
KEY SELLING POINTS OF THE ROLE
Lead a growing platform in a $68.5Bn+ market with strong M&A momentum.
Opportunity to build and own the story of a sponsor-backed roll-up.
High equity upside—aligned directly with the sponsor's contribution.
Supportive and execution-driven board with track record of value creation.
Be the face of a future $20M EBITDA exit with strategic and sponsor interest already validated.
KEY CHALLENGES FOR THE ROLE
First-time PE-backed business—requires pace, structure, and vision.
Fragmented operations and inconsistent professionalism across sites.
Low process maturity—requires hands-on transformation.
Marine sector complexity requires sensitivity to safety, regulation, and nuance.
Building trust and alignment across legacy leadership and new team.
YOUR BACKGROUND
Successful candidates will demonstrate:
Prior CEO or #2 experience in a PE-backed business.
Buy-and-build experience—deal sourcing, diligence, and integration.
Industry experience in Fire & Life Safety, Facilities Services, or related sectors.
Proven leadership across both blue- and white-collar environments.
Track record of building high-performing teams and scaling to $10M+ EBITDA.
YOUR CHARACTERISTICS
Strategic and structured thinker with execution bias.
High ownership mindset—proactive and solutions-driven.
Servant leader with strong team-building ability.
Comfortable rolling up sleeves—lead from the front.
High emotional intelligence with disciplined leadership.
LOCATION
Flexible – must be willing to travel weekly
COMPENSATION PACKAGE
Bonus: 25–35%
Equity: Up to 5% of the Management Incentive Plan (MIP), fully aligned with sponsor’s contribution
Benefits: 401k, healthcare
Raw Selection is an executive search firm working exclusively with Private Equity firms and their portfolio companies across Europe & North America.
Are you subscribed to the Private Equity Podcast?
https://www.raw-selection.com/the-private-equity-podcast/
Are you subscribed to the Private Equity YouTube channel?
https://www.youtube.com/@RawSelection
Are you part of our communities?
https://www.raw-selection.com/communities/

4280140641,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-at-dreamscape-hospitality-4280140641?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=mU4NsF5QABzGr6O0cUYpCQ%3D%3D&trackingId=YPAZuwIlGY4vHQcGR4LbQA%3D%3D,Business Analyst,Dreamscape Hospitality,"McKinney, TX","Description
Job Title: Business Analyst
Position Summary

The Business Analyst will play a key role in analyzing and improving business performance by evaluating complex problems and delivering data-driven solutions. This position requires a blend of financial expertise, technical acumen, and strong communication skills to drive operational and strategic decision-making across the organization.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze business processes and financial performance to identify areas for improvement and efficiency.
Develop and maintain financial models, forecasting tools, and dashboards using business intelligence (BI) platforms.
Collaborate with departments including Sales, Revenue Management, and Labor Management to align data-driven strategies with company goals.
Design and present budget models, operational insights, and executive summaries to leadership teams.
Extract and interpret data from various platforms, identifying trends and actionable insights.
Independently identify challenges and propose effective, scalable solutions.
Provide technical support for BI tools, APIs, and hotel-specific financial systems.
Technical Skills & Tools
Required:
Experience with APIs and API tools (e.g., Postman).
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (especially Excel).
Preferred:
Experience with BI tools such as Power BI.
Knowledge of ProfitSword.
Exposure to Labor Management, Sales, and Revenue Management systems.
Key Competencies
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, including the capacity to address and anticipate challenges proactively.
Ability to synthesize and present complex data to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Capable of managing multiple projects under pressure while meeting deadlines.
Demonstrated initiative and intellectual curiosity, with a commitment to continuous improvement.
Working Conditions & Environment
This role requires prolonged periods of sitting and working at a computer.
Must be able to occasionally lift up to 15 pounds.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to support individuals with disabilities.
Work Environment
This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive
column2: additional details will be specified by the direct supervisor. The associate may also perform other reasonable business duties assigned by their direct supervisor.

Requirements
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) from a four-year accredited college or university.
3–5 years of hotel management or hospitality industry experience (preferred).
Advanced proficiency in financial modeling, strategic planning, and data analysis.
Strong understanding of financial terms and principles, with the ability to interpret complex documentation.

Description

Job Title: Business Analyst

Position Summary

The Business Analyst will play a key role in analyzing and improving business performance by evaluating complex problems and delivering data-driven solutions. This position requires a blend of financial expertise, technical acumen, and strong communication skills to drive operational and strategic decision-making across the organization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze business processes and financial performance to identify areas for improvement and efficiency.
  • Develop and maintain financial models, forecasting tools, and dashboards using business intelligence (BI) platforms.
  • Collaborate with departments including Sales, Revenue Management, and Labor Management to align data-driven strategies with company goals.
  • Design and present budget models, operational insights, and executive summaries to leadership teams.
  • Extract and interpret data from various platforms, identifying trends and actionable insights.
  • Independently identify challenges and propose effective, scalable solutions.
  • Provide technical support for BI tools, APIs, and hotel-specific financial systems.

4278221274,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/founding-ml-researcher-%E2%80%93-llms-for-quant-at-thurn-partners-4278221274?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=mU4NsF5QABzGr6O0cUYpCQ%3D%3D&trackingId=jh7fBAIGh9IX1D%2BvIkz9Rw%3D%3D,Founding ML Researcher – LLMs for Quant,Thurn Partners,"New York, United States","Compensation: Top-of-market + significant equity
Client: Confidential | Early-stage quant research firm
Company Insight:

I’m working with a stealth-mode quant research firm at the intersection of deep learning and systematic finance. Founded by two leaders within quant finance, the team is backed by top-tier investors and has access to institutional-grade capital, proprietary financial datasets, and significant compute.

They’re building a new kind of research platform: one that uses LLMs, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and time-aware machine learning to extract signal from complex, unstructured financial data at scale.
The Role:
They are looking to bring on a Founding ML Researcher to lead the development of novel methods applying large language models to the financial domain. This person will play a core role in:
Designing LLM architectures and fine-tuning pipelines for extracting structured intelligence from financial filings, earnings transcripts, regulatory data, and macroeconomic signals.
Developing techniques to reduce hallucination, improve generalisation over time, and ground models with external data via RAG.
Building tooling to integrate text-derived signals with time-series or market data for real-world trading use.
Collaborating directly with researchers, engineers, and traders to ship high-impact research into live production environments.
Ideal Profile:
Strong background in ML/NLP, with experience in transformer architectures, LLMs, or foundation model training/fine-tuning.
2–10 years of experience in ML research or engineering, preferably with exposure to production-grade pipelines.
Experience with PyTorch, HuggingFace, DeepSpeed, or related frameworks.
Experience working with large-scale datasets, and ideally time-sensitive or financial data.
Bonus: Prior research experience in time-series forecasting, financial NLP, or alpha signal discovery
column2: PhD in CS, EE, Physics, or related field.

column1: Why Join?:
Work on frontier AI with direct real-world stakes.
Zero bureaucracy – your models go from idea to deployed signal in days.
Massive compute & capital backing without BigTech constraints.
Real ownership – equity, upside, and freedom to publish/research.
Your application is subject to our privacy policy, found here: https://www.thurnpartners.com/privacy-policy
Contact: joel.smith@thurnpartners.com

4280091274,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/python-fullstack-engineer-at-ascendion-4280091274?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=mU4NsF5QABzGr6O0cUYpCQ%3D%3D&trackingId=XEU6x9oON3%2BYFgKMZ0zIGg%3D%3D,Python FullStack Engineer,Ascendion,"Boston, MA","About Ascendion

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.
Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life
We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:
Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands
Solve complex problems – and learn new skills
Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience
Experience a community of change makers!

Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.
*** About the Role ***
Job Title: Python FullStack Engineer
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code across the full stack.
Participate in code and design reviews, and help enforce best practices.
Own and deliver individual project components from conception to deployment.
Support and troubleshoot production systems as needed.
Integrate with third-party APIs and services to enhance platform capabilities.
Maintain a strong focus on scalability, reliability, and security in all solutions.
Tech Stack & Skills:
Python – Hands-on experience with frameworks such as Flask and FastAPI.
Microservices Architecture – Ability to design and develop scalable, modular services
RESTful APIs – Proficient in building and consuming RESTful services
AWS – Experience with AWS Lambda, ECS (Elastic Container Service), and EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service)
Databases – Proficient in working with PostgreSQL (RDS) and DynamoDB
React – Strong experience in building dynamic user interfaces using modern React practices and tools
Nice to Have:
Experience integrating with third-party APIs (e.g., AuditBoard is a huge plus)
Comfortable with full end-to-end project ownership
Familiarity with production environments and support
Strong understanding of microservice architecture and distributed systems

Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $150,000 – $160,000 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [5 personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [10-15 days of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]
Want to change the world? Let us know.
Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

4280067653,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/mid-ai-engineer-at-smart-capital-center-4280067653?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=mU4NsF5QABzGr6O0cUYpCQ%3D%3D&trackingId=rITXHTHDr0hi1mbOpgBUow%3D%3D,Mid - AI Engineer,Smart Capital Center,"Texas, United States","Smart Capital Center (https://www.smartcapitalcenter.com/) is revolutionizing the commercial real estate (CRE) and fintech industries through cutting-edge AI technology and proprietary data analytics.

Our platform offers investors real-time valuations of commercial real estate and access to cost-effective lending options — all with the lowest cost and fastest turnaround time. We've transformed the origination and portfolio intelligence processes for some of the largest lenders, including KeyBank, Aareal Capital Corporation, JLL, and Pacific Life Insurance.
About the Job

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, deploying, and optimizing AI solutions centered around LLMs, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), Graph RAG, and multimodal graph technologies. You will work with modern AI frameworks and tools such as LangGraph, Milvus, and LangChain to create scalable, high-performance AI applications.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and develop AI-driven applications leveraging large language models (LLMs), RAG, and Graph RAG.
Implement and optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques for improved knowledge retrieval and contextual reasoning.
Build and maintain graph-based AI solutions, including multimodal graph architectures.
Develop and integrate AI pipelines using LangGraph, LangChain, Milvus, and other modern frameworks.
Optimize performance, scalability, and accuracy of AI models and inference pipelines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, and software developers, to build end-to-end AI solutions.
Conduct research and stay up to date with the latest advancements in LLMs, knowledge graphs, and AI-powered search and retrieval systems.
Deploy and manage AI models in production, ensuring robustness and efficiency.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering with a focus on LLMs and knowledge retrieval systems.
Proficiency in Python and AI frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX.
Experience with LangChain, LangGraph, Milvus, and other vector databases.
Strong understanding of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques and graph-based AI.
Familiarity with multimodal AI architectures and their applications.
Experience working with graph databases such as Neo4j, TigerGraph, or similar.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with distributed computing and cloud-based AI solutions (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative AI, and NLP applications.
Contributions to open-source AI projects or research publications.
Experience with deploying AI models in production environments using MLOps best practices.
Why Join Us
Be at the forefront of AI innovation: Help shape the future of real estate and fintech by working with cutting-edge AI technology and massive data sets.
Impactful work: Contribute to transforming a $17 trillion industry while collaborating with top-tier financial institutions and real estate companies.
Growth opportunities: Partner directly with the founder and executive team, gaining valuable insights into startup operations and leadership.
Lean, high-performance team: Enjoy a dynamic, no-bureaucracy work environment where your ideas and expertise will have a direct impact.
Competitive compensation and benefits: Receive generous paid time off, job-related training, and opportunities for continuous learning and development.
If you're a forward-thinking marketing leader passionate about AI technology and innovation, and eager to drive the growth of an industry-defining company, we want to hear from you!
Apply now and join Smart Capital Center in reshaping the future of commercial real estate and fintech.
Show more ","<div class=""description__text description__text--rich"">
<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">

relative overflow-hidden"">

Smart Capital Center (https://www.smartcapitalcenter.com/) is revolutionizing the commercial real estate (CRE) and fintech industries through cutting-edge AI technology and proprietary data analytics.


Our platform offers investors real-time valuations of commercial real estate and access to cost-effective lending options — all with the lowest cost and fastest turnaround time. We've transformed the origination and portfolio intelligence processes for some of the largest lenders, including KeyBank, Aareal Capital Corporation, JLL, and Pacific Life Insurance.


About the Job

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, deploying, and optimizing AI solutions centered around LLMs, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), Graph RAG, and multimodal graph technologies. You will work with modern AI frameworks and tools such as LangGraph, Milvus, and LangChain to create scalable, high-performance AI applications.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Design and develop AI-driven applications leveraging large language models (LLMs), RAG, and Graph RAG.
  • Implement and optimize retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques for improved knowledge retrieval and contextual reasoning.
  • Build and maintain graph-based AI solutions, including multimodal graph architectures.
  • Develop and integrate AI pipelines using LangGraph, LangChain, Milvus, and other modern frameworks.
  • Optimize performance, scalability, and accuracy of AI models and inference pipelines.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, and software developers, to build end-to-end AI solutions.
  • Conduct research and stay up to date with the latest advancements in LLMs, knowledge graphs, and AI-powered search and retrieval systems.
  • Deploy and manage AI models in production, ensuring robustness and efficiency.


Required Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering with a focus on LLMs and knowledge retrieval systems.
  • Proficiency in Python and AI frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX.
  • Experience with LangChain, LangGraph, Milvus, and other vector databases.
  • Strong understanding of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques and graph-based AI.
  • Familiarity with multimodal AI architectures and their applications.
  • Experience working with graph databases such as Neo4j, TigerGraph, or similar.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with distributed computing and cloud-based AI solutions (AWS, GCP, Azure).
  • Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative AI, and NLP applications.
  • Contributions to open-source AI projects or research publications.
  • Experience with deploying AI models in production environments using MLOps best practices.

Why Join Us


  • Be at the forefront of AI innovation: Help shape the future of real estate and fintech by working with cutting-edge AI technology and massive data sets.
  • Impactful work: Contribute to transforming a $17 trillion industry while collaborating with top-tier financial institutions and real estate companies.
  • Growth opportunities: Partner directly with the founder and executive team, gaining valuable insights into startup operations and leadership.
  • Lean, high-performance team: Enjoy a dynamic, no-bureaucracy work environment where your ideas and expertise will have a direct impact.
  • Competitive compensation and benefits: Receive generous paid time off, job-related training, and opportunities for continuous learning and development.

If you're a forward-thinking marketing leader passionate about AI technology and innovation, and eager to drive the growth of an industry-defining company, we want to hear from you!

Apply now and join Smart Capital Center in reshaping the future of commercial real estate and fintech.

Job Summary:

KBR, Inc. is a leader in delivering comprehensive engineering and technical solutions across military systems. They are seeking a motivated Sr. Data Scientist to support a U.S. Navy training program, focusing on enhancing Warfighter training and performance through advanced data science and AI applications.
Responsibilities:
• Research and develop data science and analysis tools for human factors and performance in naval aviation training.
• Provide data science, machine learning, and AI subject matter expertise to program management tasks.
• Conduct research in the implementation of machine learning, deep learning, GenAI, data management, and data engineering tools to facilitate big data analytics for aviation training data.
• Write programs for data exploration, data preprocessing, and feature engineering for AI applications.
• Collaborate with multiple teams and stakeholders to develop, deploy, and integrate innovative data management and AI tools to automate training and debrief activities in naval aviation.
• Evaluate DoD-developed data management and analysis software.
Qualifications:
Required:
• Master’s degree in engineering, mathematics, chemistry or related technical field.
• 10 years of related experience as listed in the roles and responsibilities above.
• Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance.
Preferred:
• PhD degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Chemistry, or related technical field.
• Advanced written and verbal communication skills.
• Published author/contributor of research literature.
• Project Management Professional (PMP) Certified.
• Experience in statistical analysis and data visualization using Python and R, SQL database engineering, and developing ML/AI pipelines and models.
Company:

At KBR, we deliver science, technology and engineering solutions that are helping governments and companies around the world take on the great challenges of our time. Founded in 1919, the company is headquartered in Houston, Texas, USA, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Public Company.

4280080711,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-intern-summer-2026-at-jobright-ai-4280080711?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=iHxLM7qDIZVMG1a6CbA7Lw%3D%3D&trackingId=KBoxq91J8sKMxZTJWtM%2BwA%3D%3D,Data Science Intern - Summer 2026,Jobright.ai,San Francisco Bay Area,"Verified Job On Employer Career Site
Job Summary:

Altruist is a modern custodian dedicated to independent financial advisors, offering a streamlined solution for trading and reporting. They are seeking a Data Science Intern for Summer 2026 to work on real projects that shape their products and user experience, focusing on statistical modeling and data analysis.
Responsibilities:
• Build and refine statistical and machine learning models to enhance revenue forecasting and business planning.
• Conduct exploratory data analysis to support GTM strategy, including funnel diagnostics, segmentation, and growth opportunity sizing.
• Leverage data science methods to support product analytics, such as feature impact analysis, usage behavior clustering, and churn modeling.
• Work with large datasets using Python and SQL for data processing, feature engineering, and model development.
• Translate analytical insights into actionable recommendations and communicate them clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Develop a deep understanding of the business, industry, codebase, and technical systems.
• Contribute to the innovation and continuous improvement of Altruist’s platform.
Qualifications:
Required:
• Must have completed at least 1 previous Data Science Internship, preferably in the startup and/or FinTech space.
• Experienced in statistics, statistical modeling, and optimization, with hands-on work in data processing, building machine learning models using Python, and working with databases using SQL.
• Currently enrolled in an M.S. or Ph.D. program in statistics, engineering, computer science, artificial intelligence, or a related quantitative field (math, physics, etc.).
• You’re technologically savvy and can easily get up to speed on modern tech stacks.
• The pride you put into every aspect of your work is unparalleled and undeniable.
• Intentional dialogue is a superpower. You listen as well as you share your perspective with others.
• We’re inspired by your unwavering determination to achieve success, no matter the adversity you face along the way.
• Your confidence is brilliant, yet ego-less. You possess a strong knowledge base, the ability to discover the unknown, and are open to differing perspectives.
• Identifying the problem is simply not enough. You’re instinctually creative with your approach in finding solutions to roadblocks.
Company:

Altruist is a modern custodian that offers a digital investment platform for financial advisors to manage their clients' investments. Founded in 2018, the company is headquartered in Culver City, California, USA, with a team of 51-200 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Altruist has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

4280145429,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/applications-engineer-at-asys-technology-group-4280145429?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=iHxLM7qDIZVMG1a6CbA7Lw%3D%3D&trackingId=wzfxio9MkBhvSDEAb6eR%2FQ%3D%3D,Applications Engineer,Asys Technology Group,"Walkerton, IN","Description

The Applications Engineer is responsible for developing programs based on engineering drawings for new and existing products but must also analyze and improve existing programs for efficiency. This role must work collaboratively and cross-functionally to promote product innovation and increase growth.
Requirements
Duties & Responsibilities
Provide a clear and concise definition of product requirements.
Review customer applications and make design recommendations.
Meet with customers to present the technical aspects of Polygon products.
Provide technical support to both customers and sales.
Identify new markets and applications for Polygon products.
Identify product gaps and provide solutions to fill those gaps.
Analyze, design, and test material and product solutions.
Perform all additional duties as assigned.
Commitment to uphold Polygon’s Core Values: Customer Committed – Customer Centered, Excellence, Pride & Passion in Our Work, Integrity Without Compromise, Care for Our Community.
Education & Training
Bachelor’s degree or higher degree, preferable Mechanical Engineering or Material Science, or related technical field.
Knowledge & Experience
Strong understanding of material science and/or composite material.
Skills & Abilities
Must possess strong project management skills and demonstrate the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Must possess strong mathematical and communication skills.
Must be an independent thinker.
Desire to grow professionally and assume more responsibility.
Ability to work with minimum supervision and work well with other individuals within the Company.
Ability to lift and move up to 20 pounds during the shift.
Working Conditions

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, associate is regularly required to sit, stand, stoop, climb, walk, use hands, talk, and hear for a minimum of eight (8) hours per shift.
Hours / Shifts: Varies depending on customer needs.

4280085199,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-ai-engineer-at-jobright-ai-4280085199?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=iHxLM7qDIZVMG1a6CbA7Lw%3D%3D&trackingId=ADElcKWR51TON9wI6%2FmgeA%3D%3D,Associate AI Engineer,Jobright.ai,"Fort Lauderdale, FL","Verified Job On Employer Career Site
Job Summary:

OneStream Software is an enterprise finance platform that unifies financial and operational data while embedding AI for better decision-making. They are seeking an Associate AI Engineer to execute AI initiatives, develop scalable applications, and bridge the gap between AI research and products. This role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams and applying data science solutions to enhance user experience.
Responsibilities:
• Develop scalable, high-performance applications and services using a variety of software architecture design patterns.
• Implement robust software systems and functionalities using Python and SQL/NoSQL, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
• Troubleshoot and debug issues across the full stack, from the user interface to the database layer.
• Participate in technical design sessions to decompose and design complex systems and interfaces.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure technical and user requirements are met.
• Must be a self-starter, continuously be learning both best code practices and the latest technologies in the Software ecosystem.
• Must understand data analysis and how to apply data science solutions into end products.
Qualifications:
Required:
• Bachelors Degree or similar work experience.
• CS/EE/CE Degree or similar experience.
• 1-2 years of experience building and deploying production-level machine learning solutions or similar experience.
• 1-2 years of strong programming experience with one of the following: Python, C++, C, CSharp, Java, Rust, or Go (or similar experience).
• Self-Starter to decompose a problem and plan a solution.
• Ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changes in technology and the business environment.
• Highly adaptive to changing circumstances, with the ability to tackle problems quickly.
• Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills.
• Excellent organization, scheduling, project management and multi-tasking skills.
• Ability to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
• Interest in continuous learning opportunities as the software landscape continues to evolve.
• Capable and comfortable effectively presenting in front of your peers.
• Proficient in effectively prioritizing and executing tasks in fast-paced, high-pressure environments.
• Highly self-motivated and proactive.
• Demonstrates meticulous attention to detail.
• Comfortable engaging and presenting to C-level executives from time to time.
• Employee must be legally authorized to work in the country of the job position as a precondition of employment.
Preferred:
• Experience building and deploying production-level software solutions or similar experience.
• Experience with webservices and API frameworks (Flask, FastAPI, etc.).
• Experience with relational or non-relational databases (MS SQL Server).
• Knowledge of distributed systems and cloud-based computing (Azure).
• Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Sklearn).
Company:

OneStream Software is an independent software company that develops a financial planning and analysis software. Founded in 2010, the company is headquartered in Rochester, Michigan, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Public Company.

4280085658,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solutions-consultant-ai-ml-mid-level-remote-at-jobright-ai-4280085658?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=iHxLM7qDIZVMG1a6CbA7Lw%3D%3D&trackingId=cl5cS%2BwxKC6%2FBYSvCLUAiQ%3D%3D,"Solutions Consultant, AI/ML, Mid-Level (Remote)",Jobright.ai,United States,"Verified Job On Employer Career Site
Job Summary:

Snowflake is a leading cloud data platform company looking for a Solutions Consultant specializing in AI/ML to join their Professional Services team. The role involves advising clients on best practices for implementing Data Science workloads on Snowflake, designing solutions based on customer requirements, and collaborating with various teams to enhance Snowflake’s offerings.
Responsibilities:
• Be a technical expert on all aspects of Snowflake in relation to the AI/ML workload.
• Provide customers with best practices and advise as it relates to Data Science workloads on Snowflake
• Build, deploy and ML pipelines using Snowflake features and/or Snowflake ecosystem partner tools based on customer requirements.
• Work hands-on where needed using SQL, Python, to build POCs that demonstrate implementation techniques and best practices on Snowflake technology within the Data Science workload.
• Follow best practices, including ensuring knowledge transfer so that customers are properly enabled and are able to extend the capabilities of Snowflake on their own
• Maintain deep understanding of competitive and complementary technologies and vendors within the AI/ML space, and how to position Snowflake in relation to them
• Work with System Integrator consultants at a deep technical level to successfully position and deploy Snowflake in customer environments
• Provide guidance on how to resolve customer-specific technical challenges.
• Support other members of the Professional Services team develop their expertise.
• Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing to continuously improve Snowflake’s products and marketing.
Qualifications:
Required:
• University degree in data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience.
• Minimum 3 years experience working with customers in a pre-sales or post-sales technical role.
• Outstanding skills presenting to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos.
• Thorough understanding of the complete Data Science life-cycle including feature engineering, model development, model deployment and model management.
• Strong understanding of MLOps, coupled with technologies and methodologies for deploying and monitoring models.
• Experience and understanding of at least one public cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP).
• Experience with at least one Data Science tool such as AWS Sagemaker, AzureML, Dataiku, Datarobot, H2O, and Jupyter Notebooks.
• Hands-on scripting experience with SQL and at least one of the following
column2: Python, Java or Scala.

column1: • Experience with libraries such as Pandas, PyTorch, TensorFlow, SciKit-Learn or similar.
Preferred:
• Experience with GenerativeAI, LLMs and Vector Databases.
• Experience with Databricks/Apache Spark.
• Experience implementing data pipelines using ETL tools.
• Experience working in a Data Science role.
• Proven success at enterprise software.
• Vertical expertise in a core vertical such as FSI, Retail, Manufacturing, etc.
Company:

Snowflake is a cloud data platform that provides a data warehouse as a service designed for the cloud. Founded in 2012, the company is headquartered in San Mateo, California, USA, with a team of 5001-10000 employees. The company is currently Public Company. Snowflake has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

4278210918,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/leadership-development-consultant-remote-at-ultimate-balance-4278210918?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=iHxLM7qDIZVMG1a6CbA7Lw%3D%3D&trackingId=A17DpIIx4Uo1X4fv85iuww%3D%3D,Leadership Development Consultant - Remote,Ultimate Balance,"District of Columbia, United States","Are you a visionary leader ready to guide others into personal freedom and purpose? Achieving work-life balance is not only about transforming yourself to the next level, but also about guiding others to do the same. This is not a structure where we give you clients to go away and coach one on one.

We're expanding globally and looking for a passionate Consultant to join our mission-driven online business. This role suits someone who thrives on impact, growth, and mentoring others toward success. We offer a results-driven compensation model designed to reward your success. If you're seeking more than just a job, if you’re looking for a life-changing pivot, this could be it.
About The Role
Guide and mentor aspiring entrepreneurs on their personal and business journey.
Lead by example, showcasing the possibilities of time freedom, financial independence, and mindset mastery.
Create and promote impactful digital content aligned with our transformational vision.
Operate autonomously while being supported by a world-class system and like-minded community.
What We're Looking For
We’re searching for someone who:
Has a passion for development and leadership.
Communicates confidently and inspires action.
Is ready to work online with flexibility and independence.
Has the drive to create real results for themselves and others.
Is committed to growth, integrity, and meaningful work.
Enjoys mentoring others and being a force for positive change.
Why Join Us?
Be part of a heart-led business with a global reach.
Work from anywhere on your terms, flexible hours, with at least 2-3 hours to immerse.
Align your work with your purpose.
If you're ready to lead, grow, and empower others while transforming your own life, we'd love to see if our goals align. Apply Now!

4266899137,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-scientist-multimodal-alignment-safety-and-fairness-at-google-deepmind-4266899137?position=3&pageNum=7&refId=dx7j5tHQdlveqRdP5Z0Iaw%3D%3D&trackingId=y%2B18A2bj7BkJ5K7f3BapcQ%3D%3D,"Research Scientist, Multimodal Alignment, Safety, and Fairness",Google DeepMind,"Mountain View, CA","This role is ideally located in Mountain View, CA. For the right candidate, there may be an option to work from either New York City, NY, Kirkland, WA, or Pittsburgh, PA.
Snapshot

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity’s most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we’re a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.
About Us

Our team's mission is to advance the frontiers of fairness, safety, and inclusion in multimodal AI, building new capabilities into Google's flagship models and products so that they work for everyone. We approach alignment research with an ecosystem view, partnering across the development and deployment cycle and grounding our work in real-world impact on global users and communities. We are a research team with a mandate to invest in longer term bets and explore innovative approaches that deliver breakthrough improvements to models (Gemini) and products. Our research advances have directly impacted multiple versions of Gemini and Imagen models.
The Role

We are seeking a Research Scientist to help leverage agentic techniques to assess and improve model safety and alignment. You will join a team working to supercharge exploration, assessment, and steering of evolving model behavior, with a focus on subjective and creative tasks. You will tackle the underlying research questions to improve collaborative specification of alignment objectives and assessment of adherence to desired behaviors.
Key responsibilities:
Design and execute experiments to validate research hypotheses
Research and develop novel techniques for agent-human interaction workflows
Research and implement techniques for modeling expected user behavior, identifying and summarizing loss patterns, balancing exploration and exploitation objectives
About You
In order to set you up for success as a Research Scientist at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:
PhD in Computer Science or related field.
Strong publication record in top machine learning conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, ECCV).
Experience in at least one modern deep learning framework (e.g. Tensorflow, JAX, PyTorch).
In addition, some of the following would be an advantage:
Experience prototyping with VLMs with modern prompting strategies (e.g., thinking / reasoning)
Experience finetuning and post-training LLMs using RL
Experience with developing agentic AI solutions to complex problems
Excited to collaborate across orgs and disciplines to leverage diverse perspectives and expertise and find creative solutions.
Interest in AI alignment/fairness/safety/responsibility.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is between $141,000 - $202,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your targeted location during the hiring process.

At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

4280067464,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-applied-scientist-%E2%80%93-artificial-general-intelligence-at-jobright-ai-4280067464?position=4&pageNum=7&refId=dx7j5tHQdlveqRdP5Z0Iaw%3D%3D&trackingId=0IxS7kUrvH6ITwVOy7Jq9w%3D%3D,Senior Applied Scientist – Artificial General Intelligence,Jobright.ai,"Boston, MA","Verified Job On Employer Career Site
Job Summary:

Amazon is a tech firm with a focus on e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence. The Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) team is seeking a passionate Applied Scientist to build technology with Large Language Models and multi-modal systems, impacting customer products and services. The role involves developing algorithms and leveraging data to advance generative AI.
Responsibilities:
• Support the development of novel algorithms and modeling techniques, to advance the state of the art with LLMs.
• Leverage Amazon’s heterogeneous data sources and large-scale computing resources to accelerate advances in generative artificial intelligence (GenAI).
• Publish in top tier conferences.
Qualifications:
Required:
• PhD, or Master's degree and 5+ years of applied research experience
• 5+ years of building machine learning models for business application experience
• Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language
• Experience with neural deep learning methods and machine learning
Preferred:
• PhD in Computer Vision, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or related field
• Experience with popular deep learning frameworks, including PyTorch
• Experience with learning multimodal LLMs and GenAI in Computer Vision, both in the image and video domains
• Experience in patents or publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals
Company:

Amazon is a tech firm with a focus on e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence. Founded in 1994, the company is headquartered in Seattle, Washington, USA, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Public Company. Amazon has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.
